DataElement.preferredName: Participant Schedule For Follow-up Visit With Oncologist For Continue Management Adverse Event Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response to a question that asks whether the participant has scehduled a follow-up visit with the oncologist for ongoing management of adverse event(s).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Participant Schedule For Follow-up Visit With Oncologist For Continue Management Adverse Event
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity._A schedule is an ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur._The reason of something._The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed._the act of going to see some person or place or thing for a short time._Used to indicate the presence of something or someone._(on-KOL-o-jist) A doctor who specializes in treating cancer.  Some oncologists specialize in a particular type of cancer treatment.  For example, a radiation oncologist specializes in treating cancer with radiation._The reason of something._Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption._The act of conducting, controlling or supervising something._Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

Property.preferredName: Schedule For Follow-up Visit With Oncologist For Continue Management Adverse Event
Property.preferredDefinition: A schedule is an ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.:The reason of something. :The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed.:the act of going to see some person or place or thing for a short time.:Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.:(on-KOL-o-jist) A doctor who specializes in treating cancer.  Some oncologists specialize in a particular type of cancer treatment.  For example, a radiation oncologist specializes in treating cancer with radiation.:The reason of something. :Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption.:The act of conducting, controlling or supervising something.:Any unfavorable and unintended sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, syndrome, or disease, temporally associated with the use of a medical product or procedure, regardless of whether or not it is considered related to the product or procedure (attribution of unrelated, unlikely, possible, probable, or definite). The concept refers to events that could be medical product related, dose related, route related, patient related, caused by an interaction with another therapy or procedure, or caused by opioid initiation or dose escalation. The term also is referred to as an adverse experience. The old term Side Effect is retired and should not be used.

Concepts.definition: An ordered list of times at which things are planned to occur.

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.
The act of going to see some person or place or thing; it can cover a short or long period but refers to a non-permanent arrangement.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
A physician who specializes in the diagnosis and treatment of cancer.
Remain in force or carry on without letup; keep or maintain in unaltered condition; exist in time or space without stop or interruption.
The act of conducting, controlling or supervising something.

Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the outcome or resolution of the patient's adverse events.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 8/3/2015 Corrections made to VD in order to restore to original format: removed C49486 as rep term and replaced with C49797; restored long name and definition per Dianne Reeves/tt.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Was participant scheduled for
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was participant scheduled for a follow up visit with her oncologist for ongoing managmement of AE/AEs?
